title: Lane City, Nevada
text:
Lane City or Mineral City was a <a href="Human%20settlement">settlement</a> in <a href="White%20Pine%20County%2C%20Nevada">White Pine County, Nevada</a>. It is now a <a href="ghost%20town">ghost town</a>.
A mining camp was founded in 1869 just west of <a href="Ely%2C%20Nevada">Ely, Nevada</a>, and named Mineral City until 1876. Since Mineral City lay on the <a href="Central%20Overland%20Route">Central Overland Route</a>, a <a href="stagecoach">stagecoach</a> stop followed, and by 1872, the <a href="boomtown">boomtown</a> had a <a href="post%20office">post office</a> and more than 600 inhabitants. In 1896 the town was renamed Lane City for Charles D. Lane, following his purchase of Chainman, a major local mining and milling operation. Lane City continued into the twentieth century, but as of 2014 the town (lying along what is now <a href="U.S.%20Route%2050%20in%20Nevada">US 50</a>) is abandoned and only a few structures and foundations remain.
